title: Protocol to evaluate cell lineage stability of mouse natural and induced regulatory T cells using bisulfite sequencing
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Sampling and cell isolation
Timing: 1–2 h
This section describes sampling lymph nodes from mice and preparation of cell suspension.
Set the 40–70 μm cell strainer on the 6 cm dish, and add 3 mL FACS buffer into them (A) (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2009-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Cell isolation from mouse lymph nodes and spleen
Placing lymph nodes and spleen into a cell strainer (A in Step 1) and mashing them using 3 mL syringe plunger in the 60 mm dish.
Collect peripheral lymph nodes and spleen, transfer them to (A). Mash them using 3 mL syringe plunger.
Transfer cell suspension into 15 mL tube. Centrifuge the sample at 500 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the sample with 1 mL Red Blood Cell Lysing Buffer Hybri-Max. Set sample for 2 min at room temperature.
Add 9 mL FACS buffer. Centrifuge the sample at 500 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with 100 μL Mouse CD4 T Lymphocyte Enrichment Cocktail and 200 μL FACS buffer. Set the sample for 15 min on ice.
Centrifuge the sample at 500 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with 100 μL Streptavidin Particles Plus and 200 μL FACS buffer. Set the sample for 15 min on ice.
Add 2 mL FACS buffer, transfer the sample to 5 mL tube. Set this tube on Cell Separation Magnet for 6 min at room temperature.
Transfer the supernatant to 15 mL tube. Centrifuge the sample at 500 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with 1 mL FACS buffer.
Cell staining and sorting
Timing: 1–2 h

This section describes cell staining by antibodies and cell sorting by FACS.
Prepare the antibody cocktail below (Table 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl1]).

Note: We prepare 5 times dilution Dead Cell Stain Kit freshly diluted by FACS buffer.
Stain the cells with the antibody cocktail. Set the sample for 15 min on ice.
Wash the cells with FACS buffer. Centrifuge the sample at 500 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Repeat step 14 (if using intracellular staining, move to step a below).
Note: If you use mice without Foxp3 reporter (ex. GFP etc.), you should stain the cells along the protocol below.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with 200 μL fixation buffer (Fixation/Permeabilization Concentrate: Fixation/Permeabilization Diluent = 1 : 3). Set the sample for 30 min on ice.
Wash the cells with permeabilization buffer. Centrifuge the sample at 600 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Repeat step b.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with the antibody cocktail below (Table 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl2]).
Wash the cells with FACS buffer. Centrifuge the sample at 600 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Repeat step e.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with 2 mL FACS buffer. Now, it is ready to sort the cells.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet with 2 mL FACS buffer. Now, it is ready to sort the cells.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_11.csv
Sort the cells (up to 100,000 cells each) into 1.5 mL tube with T cell culture medium using FACSAria II cell sorter with the gating strategy below (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2009-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Gating strategy for nTreg and naïve Tconv cells

CD4 enriched lymphocytes from Foxp3-eGFP mice were used as FACS sample. The magenta gate indicates nTreg (CD25+Foxp3+), conventional T cells (Tconv; CD25–Foxp3–), and the green gate as naïve Tconv (CD62LhiCD44lo). Sorted nTreg and naïve Tconv cells were used for the bisulfite sequence.
Note: For in vitro induced Treg (iTreg) cells induction, we referred Mikami et al., (2020)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib9], induced and sorted iTreg cells in the same way above.
Cell lysis
Timing: Overnight (12–24 h)
This section describes cell lysis and protein digestion.
Centrifuge the sample tube at 500 × g for 5 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant carefully and resuspend the pellet with 400 μL Lysis buffer.
Add 2 μL Proteinase K solution to the tube.
Shake and incubate the tube at 1,300 rpm for overnight at 55°C.
Note: If you sort the fixed cells, please shake and incubate the tube at 65°C for removing crosslink.
Pause point: If you need the stopping at step 19, store the sample at –30°C (also available from –20°C to –80°C) after resuspension.
DNA extraction
Timing: 1 h
This section describes DNA extraction from cell lysed buffer.
Add 400 μL PCI to the sample tube and vortex well. Centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 5 min at room temperature.
Transfer the upper layer (400 μL aqueous layer) to the new 1.5 mL tube.
Repeat steps 22 and 23.
Add 400 μL CIA to the sample tube and vortex well. Centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 5 min at room temperature.
Repeat step 23. Add 1 μL Ethachinmate, 40 μL 3 M sodium acetate and 1 mL 100% EtOH to the sample tube. Mix thoroughly by gentle inversion. Centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 20 min at 15°C.

Discard the supernatant carefully and add 500 μL 80% EtOH to the sample tube. Centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 15 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant carefully and dry up pellet for 5 min.
Elute the pellet with 20 μL TE buffer.
Note: If you use the fixed cells, please elute the pellet with 400 μL TE buffer, repeat step 21 at 65°C and repeat DNA extraction step again.
Bisulfite conversion
Timing: 2 h
This section describes bisulfite conversion in unmethylated CpG DNA.
The bisulfite base conversion was carried out using the Methyl Easy Xceed Rapid DNA Bisulphite Modification Kit (Human Genetic Signatures) by following the manufacturer’s protocol[href=https://www.google.co.jp/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&ved=2ahUKEwiq4ou07Lj5AhUrmFYBHZofCjkQFnoECAcQAQ&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.takarabio.com%2Fdocuments%2FUser%2520Manual%2FHGS020%2FHGS020_ME_Userguide_hires.pdf&usg=AOvVaw0Z4-rY2v46q1AKH0Uk4vBi]. If not using the kit, please perform the protocol below, we added minor modifications to previous reports (Frommer et al., 1992[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3]; Olek et al., 1996[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib15]; Rakyan et al., 2004[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib17]; Darst et al., 2010[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]; Harrison and Parle-McDermott, 2011[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib4]).
Note: We used Zymo-Spin IC Columns as the collecting columns in the alternative protocol.
Note: We set heat blocks at 80°C, 37°C, and 95°C.
Prepare the bisulfite solution (Table 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl3], for 4 samples). Set this solution at 80°C.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_12.csv
Note: 3.5 mM sodium disulfite in 0.45 M NaOH solution is the substitute as the bisulfite solution.
Add 2.2 μL 3 M NaOH to 20 μL sample. Set the sample tube for 15 min at 37°C.
Add 220 μL bisulfite solution to the sample tube. Set the sample tube for 1 h at 80°C.
Add 500 ng salmon sperm DNA solution and 240 μL Buffer PB to the sample tube.
Transfer the sample to the column and centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 30 s at room temperature.
Discard the flowthrough. Add 200 μL Buffer PE to the column and centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 30 s at room temperature.

Repeat step 35.
Discard the flowthrough. Set the column on the new 1.5 mL tube and add 50 μL 50 mM NaOH to the column.
Set the column for 1 min at room temperature. Centrifuge it at 15,000 × g for 30 s at room temperature.
Set the sample for 30 min at 95°C for the desulfonation. Add 5 μL 1 M TrisHCl (pH7.5) to the sample.
Set the sample on ice. Now, it is ready to use the sample for bisulfite PCR.
Pause point: Able to store the sample at 4°C until next step.
Note: 3 M NaOH will be expired in 4 weeks. Please prepare the solution freshly if possible.
Note: 10 mM CAPS buffer is the substitute as 50 mM NaOH in step 37. In this case, adding 1 M TrisHCl is not necessary.
Note: Insufficient desulfonation leads to failed bisulfite PCR. Desulfonation for 30 min or more is better.
Bisulfite PCR
Timing: 2.5 h
This section describes targeted bisulfite PCR in TSDRs.
We used the primers for the bisulfite PCR (Table 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl4]) from Ohkura et al. (2012)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib13].
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_13.csv
Note: If you need some different primers or design these on distinct regions, we recommend using MethPrimer software (Li and Dahiya, 2002[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]).
We used TaKaRa Ex Taq® Hot Start Version (Takara) for bisulfite PCR.
Prepare the bisulfite PCR mix (Table 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl5]). Set this mix on ice until PCR.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_14.csv
Run the PCR program below (Table 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl6]).
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_15.csv
Electrophoresis of the PCR products using 2% agarose gel (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]).

Figure 3. Electrophoresis of bisulfite PCR products in Foxp3-CNS2 region of naïve Tconv and nTreg cells
We used the Methyl Easy Xceed Rapid DNA Bisulphite Modification Kit as a commercial bisulfite kit, and the original protocol using two different elution buffers.

Cut the aimed band in the gel and transfer the gel pieces to 1.5 mL tube.
Pause point: Able to store the sample at –30°C until next step for 1 month.
Gel extraction
Timing: 30 min
This section describes extraction of bisulfite PCR products from gel pieces.
The DNA extraction from the gel pieces was carried out using QIAEX II Gel Extraction Kit (QIAGEN) by following the manufacturer’s protocol[href=https://www.qiagen.com/mt/resources/download.aspx?id=8a1e1b5f-70be-480b-bc9d-8eb444ff7b63&lang=en].
After dissolving and removing the gel and washing with the silica beads (QIAEX II Suspension), elute the pellet with 8 μL TE buffer.
Ligation of PCR products for TA cloning
Timing: 30 min–2 h
This section describes ligation of extracted PCR products into the vector.
The TA cloning was carried out using DynaExpress TA PCR Cloning Kit (BioDynamics). We used the water bathes at 42°C and 37°C.
Prepare the vector ligation mix (Table 7[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl7]) in 1.5 mL tube. Set the tube on ice until a ligation step.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_16.csv
Set the tube onto a heat block at 16°C for 30 min–2 h.
DH5α transformation
Timing: 1 h
This section describes transformation of competent cells.
Note: Add 50 μL 0.1 M IPTG and 50 μL 2%(w/v) X-gal to the Kanamycin-added LB plate and spread these solutions well.
Add optimized DH5α competent cells solution to the tube. Set the tube on ice for 10 min.
Set the tube in the water bath for 45 s at 42°C.
Transfer the tube on ice. Add SOC solution (10 times volume of the sample) to the tube.
Set the tube in the water bath for 30–45 min at 37°C.
Centrifuge the tube at 2,200 × g for 3 min at room temperature.
Discard the supernatant until 100 μL. Spread the cell suspension gently and well.
Put the plate in the incubator (5% CO2 37°C) for 12–16 h.

Pause point: The colony formed plate can be stored at 4°C until you move to the next step.
Colony PCR
Timing: 4.5 h
This section describes colony PCR after DH5α transformation.
Note: We used illustra TempliPhi DNA Amplification Kit for Rolling Circle Amplification. In addition, we modified the protocol from the manufacturer.
Aliquot 2.5 μL Denature buffer into the PCR tube or 96 well PCR plate.
Pick up a white colony by the toothpick, then dip the colony into the Denature buffer.
Set the sample on the thermal cycler for 3 min at 95°C.
Remove the sample from the thermal cycler and add 2.5 μL Premix into it.
Set the sample on the thermal cycler for 4 h at 30°C, 10 min at 65°C, and keep it at 25°C.
Remove the sample from the thermal cycler.
Pause point: Able to store the sample at 4°C until next step for 24 h.
Big dye
Timing: 2 h
This section describes Big Dye PCR.
Note: We used BigDyeTM Terminator v3.1 Cycle Sequencing Kit for analyzing the PCR product-inserted plasmid vector. In addition, we modified the protocol from the manufacturer.
Prepare the BigDye mix below (Table 8[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl8]), and put the mix on ice in dark until the reaction.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_17.csv
Run the program below (Table 9[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl9]) by the thermal cycler.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2009_18.csv
Remove the sample from the thermal cycler.
Pause point: Able to store the sample at 4°C in dark until next step for 24 h.
Note: We performed our original modified protocol here. Please check each setting in your lab.
Purification of the sequencing reactions
Timing: 10 min
This section describes purification of Big Dye PCR products before the sequencing.
Add 1.5 μL CleanSEQ beads and 40 μL 80% ethanol into each well.

Vortex and spin down, and set the PCR tube or plate on the magnetic rack for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant with taking care of the beads.
Add 100 μL 80% ethanol into each well.
Repeat steps 65 and 66.
Dry the beads well. Add 18 μL water into each well.
Repeat step 65.
Transfer the sample-eluted water to the sequencing plate.
Note: Do not transfer the beads to the sequencing plate for avoiding a sequencing error.
Sequencing
Timing: 1 h
This section describes definition of the TSDR methylation by Sanger sequencing.
Note: We used 3500×L Genetic Analyzer for Sanger sequencing and performed “RapidSeq” mode.
Prepare the sample sheet and modify the sequencing setting.
Sequence the sample.
Analyze the base called sequence data by base analyzing tools.
Check the methylation status according to the reference sequence. We show the Foxp3 CNS2 region as an example below (Table 10[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl10]).
